title: Social Media Manager Job at Duob Recruitment
content:
Duob Recruitment - Our client provides businesses with a professional phone system that enables teams to manage customer calls efficiently. Their goal is to help businesses improve the quality of their customer interactions while enhancing operational efficiency.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	They are looking for a Social Media Manager with strong creative instincts, a strategic mindset, and a deep understanding of internet culture.
	This person will lead our client’s social media efforts, from curating content to managing campaigns, while making sure everything aligns with the brand.
	If you’re someone who loves jumping on trends, turning insights into strategy, and using content to drive real business growth, this role is for you.


Key Responsibilities


	Own and manage all social media platforms (Instagram, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, TikTok)
	Monitor trends, viral content, conversations and tie them back to our client’s mission in a meaningful and timely way
	Plan, curate, and publish creative content across all platforms to increase engagement and visibility
	Use tools like Hootsuite to schedule, monitor, and analyse content performance
	Track performance metrics and optimise based on data and user insights
	Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Design, Growth, and Customer Success teams to support marketing campaigns
	Strategically manage organic and paid social campaigns from start to finish
	Develop a consistent tone of voice that builds brand recognition and strengthens community trust.


Key Success Metrics


	Growth in engagement rate and follower count across platforms
	Increase in link clicks and social-driven web traffic
	Improved brand visibility and consistency online
	Campaign success rates based on defined objectives (reach, engagement, conversions)
	Timely and relevant engagement with social trends
	Quality of content and alignment with brand essence.


Requirements


	3+ years of experience managing social media for a brand, preferably in a fast-paced environment
	Strong understanding of social media algorithms, culture, and real-time marketing
	A creative thinker with the ability to execute ideas fast
	Proficiency in social media scheduling and analytics tools (e.g. Hootsuite, Buffer, Later, etc.)
	Excellent written communication skills and an eye for compelling visuals
	Familiarity with tools like Canva, CapCut, or Adobe Suite is a plus
	Analytical and data-driven, comfortable using insights to guide strategy.


Benefits


	Be part of a company solving a deep and urgent problem for African businesses
	Collaborate with a smart, driven, and kind team
	Freedom to take ownership and innovate
	Opportunity to shape the voice of one of Africa’s most promising startups
	Work remotely with flexible hours
	Competitive salary and performance-based growth opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrdamilolaasoata@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Assistant Finance Manager Job at KKON Technologies
content:
KKONTech stands as an Open Access Network provider with a dedicated focus on Fiber To The Business (FTTB) and metro wireless radio service, aiming to establish flawless fiber and radio connectivity for numerous businesses throughout the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Finance Manager

Job Location: Anthony Village, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Objective
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The assistant manager finance is responsible for overseeing and coordinating the day-to-day activities of the finance team, ensuring the accurate and timely preparation of financial reports, managing financial operations, and maintaining compliance with company policies and financial regulations.
	The role involves providing leadership to junior finance staff, driving process improvements, and supporting the Finance Manager in achieving departmental goals.
	The assistant manager will also play a key role in ensuring the company’s financial health through effective management of accounting processes and financial reporting.


Job Description


	Ensure the correctness of all General ledgers
	Supervision of customers receipt and ensure collections are according to SLA timelines
	Ensure the corrections of all reports (Monthly and weekly)
	Timeline submission of report
	Prepare cashflow projections for business plan and other projects.
	Prepare ad hoc reports and analysis as required
	Perform month end closure activity.
	Ensure Statutory and regulatory compliance
	Prepare supplementary reports when required.
	Ensure correctness of monthly bank reconciliation for FM sign off
	prepare and perform check runs
	Ensure 100% Statutory and regulatory compliance.
	Engagement with external and internal audit activities.
	provide supporting documentation for audits
	maintain accurate historical records by verifying all payment supportive documents on Bitrix.
	Ensure OLA are complied with.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: careers@fob.ng using Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Our commitment to excellence, efficiency, and integrity makes us a trusted partner in workforce solutions.

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

title: Civil Engineer Job at Elvaridah Limited
content:
At Elvaridah, we emphasize on the critical matters and prospects of organizations such as business growth, strategy, planning, marketing, structure, and people management across different industries. We help companies focus on the growth of their businesses while aligning costs with strategy. With our all-inclusive approach and expertise, we capture values across the boundaries of any organization. Elvaridah focuses on optimizing all the different parts of a business as a unit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Real Estate
Reports To: Operations Manager

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Civil Engineer is responsible for planning, designing, overseeing, and managing construction and infrastructure projects from conception to completion.
	This role ensures that all civil works on site are executed according to approved designs, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.


Key Duties and Responsibilities
Project Planning and Design Review:


	Interpret architectural and structural drawings to understand construction requirements.
	Participate in site planning, layout designs, and interpretation of construction blueprints.
	Recommend modifications to design or construction methods where necessary.


Site Supervision and Execution:


	Oversee daily construction activities and ensure work is carried out according to specifications.
	Monitor the progress of civil works and ensure timely completion of project milestones.
	Supervise site workers and subcontractors to ensure adherence to quality and safety standards.


Quality Control:


	Ensure that all materials used and work performed meet quality standards and specifications.
	Conduct regular inspections to identify defects, non-compliance, or deviations from the plan.


Material and Resource Management:


	Estimate material quantities and prepare requisitions for procurement.
	Coordinate with the storekeeper and Assistant Admin to ensure availability and proper usage of materials.


Technical Reporting and Documentation:


	Maintain accurate project documentation including site diaries, material logs, and progress reports.
	Report technical issues, delays, or risk factors to the project or operations manager promptly.


Regulatory Compliance:


	Ensure all site activities comply with local building codes, health and safety regulations, and environmental standards.
	Liaise with government inspectors and agencies when necessary.


Team Collaboration:


	Work closely with architects, structural engineers, quantity surveyors, and other project stakeholders.
	Assist in resolving site conflicts or issues that may impact progress.


Cost and Time Efficiency:


	Monitor project budget and timeline to avoid overruns and delays.
	Recommend cost-saving construction methods or alternatives when necessary.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or related field.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of proven experience in building construction or real estate development projects.
	COREN certification is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of construction methods, project management tools, and engineering standards.
	Proficient in AutoCAD, Microsoft Project, and other engineering software.
	Excellent leadership, problem-solving, and communication skills.


Salary
N300,000 - N350,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume and a cover letter to: careers@elvaridah.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Human Resources Officer Job at Valency Agro Nigeria Limited
content:
Valency Agro Nigeria Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer
Job Location: Ibafo / Mowe, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assist with recruitment activities, including posting job vacancies, screening resumes, scheduling interviews, and onboarding new employees
	Prepare employment letters, contracts, and other HR-related documentation
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and HR databases
	Track attendance, leave, and performance appraisal schedules
	Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information with discretion
	Manage office supplies and ensure timely replenishment of materials and equipment
	Maintain filing systems for both HR and administrative documents (digital and physical)
	Schedule meetings, prepare agendas, and take minutes when required
	Support the implementation and enforcement of HR policies and procedures
	Organize and coordinate staff training, development programs, and wellness activities
	Respond to employee inquiries regarding HR policies, benefits, and procedures
	Coordinate logistics for office maintenance, facility services, and vendor management
	Assist in planning and executing company events, staff engagements, and meetings
	Monitor renewal schedules for service contracts, subscriptions, and licenses
	Provide general administrative support to the HR Manager and other departments
	Contribute to fostering a professional, efficient, and compliant work environment
	Perform other related duties as assigned by HR or management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field
	3 - 5 years of experience in HR, administration, or office management (internship experience may be considered)
	Strong understanding of HR principles, labor laws, and office procedures
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
	Excellent organizational and multitasking skills
	Strong verbal and written communication abilities
	Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and professionalism
	High attention to detail and accuracy
	Positive attitude and a proactive, problem-solving mindset
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team
	Knowledge of HR software or tools is an added advantage.


Benefits


	Competitive monthly salary (N150,000 - N200,000)
	Opportunities for professional growth and on-the-job learning
	Exposure to both HR and administrative functions
	Friendly and supportive work environment
	Staff wellness and engagement programs
	Health Insurance
	Experience working with a dynamic team in a growing organization.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrfactory@valencyafrica.com using the Job Positon as the subject of the email.
